cn:slug: CFO COUNCIL HAJJAR SOLVAY S.A. VOLASTRO 051017
cn:title: Karim Hajjar, Solvay S.A.
headline: Karim Hajjar, Solvay S.A.

description: Karim Hajjar is CFO for Solvay S.A.

cn:section.cn:title: CNBC Global CFO Council
cn:section.cn:summary: CNBC has assembled an elite group of chief financial officers representing public and private companies from various major sectors, to share their frontline insights and unique views on key issues and challenges facing today’s CFOs.

cn:section.name: CNBC Global CFO Council

cn:bodyTeaser:
Karim Hajjar joined Solvay S.A. as CFO and member of the executive committee in September 2013. Prior to that, he had a varied career that started in 1984 at Grant Thornton Chartered Accountants in London, where he became a partner in 1993, specializing in SMEs across numerous industries and in corporate distress.  

He moved to Royal Dutch/Shell in 1995 and undertook a number of roles in the UK, Sultanate of Oman and Singapore, where his last role was deputy global CFO of Shell Chemicals. 

Karim subsequently joined Tarmac Group (a division of Anglo American Plc) as group CFO before being appointed as group managing director in 2009. He then briefly took the role of director of finance and planning at Imperial Tobacco Group Plc in 2011 before joining Solvay in 2013 to contribute to its transformation.  

Karim is a dual British-Lebanese national, an economics graduate from the City University in London and is a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales. He is married and has four children.

Karim subsequently joined Tarmac Group (a division of Anglo American Plc) as group CFO before being appointed as group managing director in 2009. Karim is a dual British-Lebanese national, an economics graduate from the City University in London and is a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales. He is married and has four children.
articlebody:
Karim Hajjar joined Solvay S.A. as CFO and member of the
  executive committee in September 2013. Prior to that, he had a
  varied career that started in 1984 at Grant Thornton Chartered
  Accountants in London, where he became a partner in 1993,
  specializing in SMEs across numerous industries and in corporate
  distress.  


  He moved to Royal Dutch/Shell in 1995 and undertook a number of
  roles in the UK, Sultanate of Oman and Singapore, where his last
  role was deputy global CFO of Shell Chemicals. 


  Karim subsequently joined Tarmac Group (a
  division of Anglo American Plc) as group CFO before being
  appointed as group managing director in 2009. He then briefly
  took the role of director of finance and planning at Imperial
  Tobacco Group Plc in 2011 before joining Solvay in 2013 to
  contribute to its transformation.  


  Karim is a dual British-Lebanese national, an
  economics graduate from the City University in London and is a
  member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and
  Wales. He is married and has four children.

cn:association.cn:title: CNBC Global CFO Council
cn:association.cn:summary: CNBC has assembled an elite group of chief financial officers representing public and private companies from various major sectors, to share their frontline insights and unique views on key issues and challenges facing today’s CFOs.
cn:association.headline: CNBC Global CFO Council
cn:association.cn:shorterDescription: Frontline insights and unique views on key issues and challenges facing today’s CFOs.
cn:association.cn:shortestDescription: Frontline insights and unique views on key issues and challenges facing today’s CFOs.

cn:association.cn:title: CNBC Special Reports
cn:association.description: Find CNBC Special Reports with News and Analysis on Investing, Technology, Real Estate, Breaking News and Special Events.

cn:association.cn:title: HDFC: Demand for housing loans will remain strong
cn:association.description: Keki Mistry, HDFC's CEO and CFO, expects India's demographics to support demand for housing loans.

cn:association.cn:title: China seen as biggest risk for Asian CFOs: Survey
cn:association.description: The pace of China's economic transition has significant impact on power industries, explains Geert Peeters, CFO of electric company CLP Holdings.

cn:association.cn:title: Ransomware: The latest cyber threat
cn:association.description: Ransomware is the latest breed of cyber attacks threatening both corporates and individuals, explains Mahendra Negi, CFO of Trend Micro.

cn:association.cn:title: Shifting loan trends hit Danamon's profits
cn:association.cn:slug: Shifting loan trends hit Danamon's profits v3000438609
cn:association.description: Vera Eve Lim, CFO of Bank Danamon and a member of CNBC's CFO Council, says net profits for the first three quarters were lower on changes in loan trends, but that there were also positive trends emerging.

cn:association.cn:title: Wells Fargo CFO: Great growth across the board
cn:association.cn:slug: Wells Fargo CFO: Great growth across the board v3000234732
cn:association.description: Discussing Q4 earnings and the decline in mortgage lending, with Tim Sloan, Wells Fargo CFO.

cn:association.cn:title: Trulia's housing indicator shows mixed market
cn:association.cn:slug: Trulia's housing indicator shows mixed market v3000235135
cn:association.description: It's going to be an uneven recovery, says Sean Aggarwal, Chief Financial Officer at Trulia, sharing his thoughts on the outlook on housing. We¿ve seen a very sustained recovery in 2014, says Aggarwal.

cn:association.cn:title: Ford CFO: Emerging markets are a concern
cn:association.cn:slug: Ford CFO: Emerging markets are a concern v3000240583
cn:association.description: CNBC's Phil LeBeau talks with Robert Shanks, Ford Motor Company CFO, about the automaker's strong year and how emerging market turmoil is impacting their bottom line.

cn:association.cn:title: UBS CFO 'neutral' on emerging markets
cn:association.cn:slug: UBS CFO 'neutral' on emerging markets v3000241531
cn:association.description: Tom Naratil, UBS CFO, shares his thoughts on where his bank is finding value in global opportunities. The outlook for the U.S. is good, says Naratil.

cn:association.cn:title: Wells Fargo CFO: In midst of good housing recovery
cn:association.cn:slug: Wells Fargo CFO: In midst of good housing recovery  v3000245252
cn:association.description: Wells Fargo CFO Tim Sloan weighs in on the housing recovery, competition, and banking regulations. Sloan says affordability in the housing industry is still very good.

cn:association.cn:title: Global CFO survey shows fears of consumer spending slump
cn:association.cn:slug: Global CFO survey shows fears of consumer spending slump v3000247908
cn:association.description: Nearly half of 51 chief financial officers (CFO) polled by CNBC cited weakening consumer demand as their biggest concern. CNBC's Asia Squawk Box team discuss the findings with Guy Look, CFO and Executive Director of Sasa International and Mohamed Rafique Merican, Group CFO of Maybank Group.

cn:association.cn:title: Consumers continuing to 'tighten belt': Sainsbury CFO
cn:association.cn:slug: Consumers continuing to 'tighten belt': Sainsbury CFO v3000248401
cn:association.description: John Rogers, CFO of J Sainsbury, says consumers are still feeling the pinch despite an economic recovery as wage growth continues to fall behind inflation.

cn:association.cn:title: UK seeing 'greenshoots' of recovery, but uneven: Unilever CFO
cn:association.cn:slug: UK seeing 'greenshoots' of recovery, but uneven: Unilever CFO v3000248491
cn:association.description: Jean-Marc Huët, CFO of Unilever, says the U.K.'s recovery is in its early stages but is uneven.

cn:association.cn:title: Planning around geopolitical events: CFO Council
cn:association.cn:slug: Planning around geopolitical events: CFO Council v3000251351
cn:association.description: Philip Broadway, CFO at Old Mutual and Chris Kennedy, CFO at easyJet discuss how geopolitical shocks, like the situation in Ukraine, can impact business planning.

cn:association.cn:title: Europe needs to boost internal demand: STMicroelectronics CFO
cn:association.cn:slug: Europe needs to boost internal demand: STMicroelectronics CFO  v3000248804
cn:association.description: Carlo Ferro, CFO at ST Microelectronics, says the European economy is seeing a recovery but needs to boost internal demand.

cn:association.cn:title: Franchise Root
